pr_title: Added support for listing and aborting WarpScript executions

timeline.bodyText:
That's great, but could be greater : is it possible to pass the session attribute_name and the attribute_session in a req.header ?
With this mecanism, both VScode and WarpStudio can inject meaningful headers automatically, and will be able to abort the current session easily. I already developed the function to stop everything, it will be easy to add a uuid session name at startup, and a request to abort scripts:

Both new headers name should be hardcoded, to avoid too much settings both in Warp 10 and WarpScript tooling.
Keep this default name if there is no headers in request.
timeline.author: pi-r-p

replies.bodyText: Why can't they add a prefix to the WarpScript code they push?
replies.author: hbs

replies.bodyText:
It is more simple than prepend lines, shift line numbers or statement number in error messages. VSCode already does macro inlining and error message transformations, studio does not.
It does not appear in the 'warpscript.script' WarpScript logs.
More flexible to enforce some extra policy later, for example include the user name in each request, or to add a proxy that automatically add the incoming IP or other metadata in attribute_name if a company want to find who is taking all the shared resources. (128 character is a bit too short for that)
replies.author: pi-r-p

replies.bodyText:
You don't need to shift lines as you could very well set the session on the first line without a LF.
Having an alternate way of setting things just for the /exec endpoint brings redundancy and lack of coherency without added value, therefore this will not be added.
replies.author: hbs

replies.bodyText:
Second thoughts, added possibility to set the session via header (but not the name), but disallowed overwriting the session in WSSESSION.
PTAL.
